nodes.bodyText: Why make this a variable if it is only used once?
It's actually used twice, on line 35250 and 35263
My search was off, my bad
You could actually use entity.getUnitType() to do this.
Fortress is a comparison to Building.Fortress, Brian's aren't implemented
Missing a space on the for (
shortName is used for display to users in contexts where the full name may be too long. It's used particularly on record sheets.
Maybe use capital letter instead of lowercase here? l, 1, I, and | can be annoying to tell the difference between them, but L is easy to tell.
Is that - after the first <data> intended?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1189,3 +1189,12 @@
 9982=Pulse
 9983=Missile
 9984=Burst-fire
+
+9986=Insufficient atmospheric pressure for fuel-air weapon. No damage inflicted.
+9987=Fuel-air weapon against infantry may result in automatic destruction. Needs <data>-, rolled <data> (2d6) + <data> (distance from blast center) : <msg:9989,9988>

nodes.bodyText: Yes, unlike every other type of roll in battletech, you're trying to roll lower than the target number.
